content: How many times does Earth rotate on its axis during one orbit around the Sun?

Earth rotates approximately 365.25 times on its axis during one complete orbit around the Sun. This is because Earth takes about 365.25 days to orbit the Sun once, and it rotates once per day. The extra quarter rotation accounts for the leap year, which adds an extra day every four years to keep our calendar in alignment with the Earth's revolutions around the Sun.
